name: C.E.O. 15% Vitamin C Brightening Serum
about: What it is:An advanced serum with plant saccharides and 15 percent vitamin C (THD ascorbate) to visibly minimize pores, brighten dark spots, and target signs of aging..Skin Type:Normal, Dry, Combination, and Oily.Skincare Concerns:Dark Spots, Fine Lines and Wrinkles, and Dullness.Formulation:Serum.Highlighted Ingredients:- Advanced Vitamin C (THD Ascorbate): A more stable version of vitamin C that targets visible signs of aging including dullness, loss of firmness, fine lines, wrinkles, dark spots, and redness..Ingredient Callouts:Free of parabens, formaldehydes, formaldehyde-releasing agents, phthalates, mineral oil, retinyl palmitate, oxybenzone, coal tar, hydroquinone, sulfates SLS & SLES, triclocarban, triclosan, and contains less than one percent synthetic fragrance. It is also gluten-free and cruelty-free..What Else You Need to Know:Powered by a stable, advanced form of vitamin C, this serum rapidly absorbs into skin to visibly brighten and diminish signs of aging while providing powerful antioxidant protection. It leaves skin looking hydrated and firm with less-visible dark spots and wrinkles over time.
ingredients: -Vitamin C (15% THD Ascorbate): Features superior visible brightening, clarifying, and antioxidant properties; helps fight the first signs of aging caused by stress, lifestyle, sun, and pollution...-Phytosterols Complex: Isolated from soybeans and containing at least 40 percent beta-sitosterol, it helps reduce the look of redness and skin sensitivity.   ..-Saccharide Isomerate Extract: Reduces the appearance of pores while reinforcing the skin's natural moisture barrier for smooth, supple texture.   ..-Glycolic Acid: Provides mild refinement to the skin; maintains the pH of the serum for maximum vitamin C efficacy, while supporting natural cell turnover and glow of the skin.   ...Water, Tetrahexyldecyl Ascorbate, Squalane, PEG-8 Beeswax, Hydrogenated Polydecene, Polyglyceryl-6 Distearate, PPG-12/SMDI Copolymer, Phenoxyethanol, Acetamidoethoxyethanol, Jojoba Esters, Sodium Acrylate/Sodium Acryloyldimethyl Taurate Copolymer, Glycine Soja Sterols, Tocopherol, Glycolic Acid, Caprylyl Glycol, Sodium Phytate, Citrus Aurantium Dulcis (Sweet Orange) Oil, Chlorphenesin, Cera Alba, Glycerin, Isosqualane, C30 Hydrocarbons, Saccharide Isomerate...The list of ingredients is subject to change. Please consult the packaging of the product purchased.
how_to_use: Suggested Usage:.-Use AM and/or PM..-For antioxidant protection and a glowing look, apply two pumps every morning to clean skin..-For visibly brighter, firmer skin overnight, apply after you cleanse before bedtime...Sunday says:.-I use C.E.O. 15% Vitamin C Brightening Serum twice a day. In the morning, I make a vitamin C cocktail for my skin by mixing two to three pumps with three drops of C.E.O Glow Vitamin C + Turmeric Face Oil. I massage it well into my skin and it rapidly soaks in, and my skin visibly glows. In the morning, I follow with Good Genes All-In One Lactic Acid Treatment and a dab of Tidal Brightening Enzyme Water Cream and then sunscreen. In the evening, I use C.E.O. 15% Vitamin C Brightening Serum after my retinoid step (A+ High-Dose Retinol Serum and Luna Retinol Sleeping Night Oil). I then follow with ICE Ceramide Moisturizing Cream. (All additional products are sold separately.)

I started getting little breakout, which was unusual for me, then my skin looked dull a few weeks later. Once I started the TruSkin Vitamin C Sreum, after a week my skin started looking brighter again so it was definitely the CEO serum. This is not for everyone, I would use a sample size to see how your skin reacts before committing to a bigger size, especially with the price.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Hazel eyes, blonde hair, Dry skin
reviews.review_text: I am one of those people who will test a product vigorously before writing a review and I tend to only write positive reviews keeping the negative stuff to myself, however, I feel like I need to put a warning out there for anyone trying this product. I received my sample in July 2023. I used my beauty rewards points to get one of the better sized samples during checkout. I was excited to try this product as I had heard and read good things. I tried it shortly after receiving it. I used the tiniest amount and my skin felt like I had a sunburn and it was irritated so I put it away for awhile. Fast forward to February 2024 and I used a pea size amount on my face and felt nothing and then nothing the next day either and I thought maybe my skin was ready for Vitamin C? Maybe it just wasn't as strong anymore? Then on day 2, I woke up to my eyes sealed shut, a severely swollen face, skin so terribly irritated that the only thing I can tolerate is using a water facial mist spray which helps cool my face. My face is red, rough in texture and burns. I have spent years and a lot of money on good products to be told how youthful and beautiful my skin looks. Today, I barely recognize myself in the mirror and I can't even cry about it because my tears sting my face. I put this serum on my face 5 days ago and I am no better than Day 2 when I woke up with my eyes sealed shut. I spoke with a pharmacist who says to give it a full week and if I'm no better then I will be given a prescription for a steroid to help alleviate the severe reaction my skin has had. For reference, I am 49 years old and have normal skin. I would never post a picture of myself looking this terrible and just so you know, this picture doesn't do any justice to how bad it really is but I think it is important to inform and show you just how bad it's been. Please be careful with this product. I DO NOT recommend it and the only thing I'm thankful for is: I didn't spend $$$ on this product.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Brown eyes, black hair, Normal skin
reviews.review_text: I saw a concerning amount of reviews that stated this caused irritation. What was most notable to me was the consistent way in which each person describes the irritation; A pattern in the type of irritation this causes. Despite, I still bought it.   L-ascorbic acid and I are not friends so I opt for Tetrahexyldecyl Ascorbate (THD), her more stable less irritating younger sister, which is what this product contains. I do not have sensitive skin. I use many actives, and Tretinoin with no issues. L-Ascorbic acid is the only ingredient that has ever given me any trouble; THD has been a fabulous alternative for me. As many other reviewers have mentioned something in here is concerningly irritating. After 3 days of use I have a rash all over my face that mimics the same allergic reaction I typically have when I eat nuts (nut allergy). For a week I reviewed my food choices trying to figure out how I missed an ingredient because I typically eat the same foods or food groups. It then hit me that the rash appeared at the end of the 3rd day of use of this product. I stopped immediately and 3 days later we are 80% back to normal. My rash started on my eyelids and brow area, then my right cheek, chin, upper lip, and was beginning to make its way to my forehead prior to stopping. Citrus oils are known irritants, perhaps it is that... This will be returned.

reviews.review_buyer_description: Green eyes, Fair skin tone, Combination skin
reviews.review_text: I got this as a sample and decided to use a little bit at night before bed, but what a mistake that was. I used 1 tiny pump like it suggested, patted it lightly on my face and forehead, making sure to thoroughly avoid my eye area by several inches, and went to bed. Next morning my face was bright red, inflamed, eyelids and under eyes swollen, flaky and dry. I now have a swollen lymph node by my ear, my face is peeling like I got a bad sunburn, and my whole face is swollen like a red tomato.   I've tried vitamin c products in the past and not had this same reaction, so I don't think this is stabilized at all and is just straight up acid on your skin. If you have even the slightest skin sensitivity, I would avoid this product like the plague! It's been days now and I still can't wear makeup or put anything else onto my skin except petroleum jelly to soothe the inflammation.   The irony of using a product to improve your skin, but instead it's destroyed it. Avoid!
